title: Contributor Code of Conduct
text: contributors maintainers project, pledge respect people contribute reporting issues, posting feature requests, updating documentation, submitting pull requests patches, activities. committed making participation project harassment-free experience everyone, regardless level experience, gender, gender identity expression, sexual orientation, disability, personal appearance, body size, race, ethnicity, age, religion. Examples unacceptable behavior participants include use sexual language imagery, derogatory comments personal attacks, trolling, public private harassment, insults, unprofessional conduct. Project maintainers right responsibility remove, edit, reject comments, commits, code, wiki edits, issues, contributions aligned Code Conduct. Project maintainers follow Code Conduct may removed project team. Instances abusive, harassing, otherwise unacceptable behavior may reported opening issue contacting one project maintainers. Code Conduct adapted Contributor Covenant (http:contributor-covenant.org), version 1.0.0, available http://contributor-covenant.org/version/1/0/0/

title: CONTRIBUTING
text: Fork repo GitHub account Clone version account machine account, e.g,. git clone https://github.com/ropensci/essurvey.git Make sure track progress upstream (.e., version essurvey ropensci/essurvey) git remote add upstream https://github.com/ropensci/essurvey.git. making changes make sure pull changes upstream either git fetch upstream merge later git pull upstream fetch merge one step Make changes (bonus points making changes new feature branch - see https://guides.github.com/introduction/flow/ contribute branching, making changes, submitting pull request) Push account Submit pull request home base (likely master branch, check make sure) ropensci/essurvey

title: Introduction to the essurvey package
text: Using essurvey package fairly easy. two main families functions: import_* show_*. complement allow user almost never go European Social Survey (ESS) website. scenario need enter ESS website validate email. haven’t registered, create account http://www.europeansocialsurvey.org/user/new. unfamiliar ESS, vignette uses term rounds, synonym waves denote survey different time points. register visit email account validate account ’re ready access data. Given essurvey functions require email address, vignette use fake email everything work accordingly registered ESS.

title: Introduction to the essurvey package
text: Note: versions less including essurvey 1.0.1 returned wrong countries. Please install latest CRAN/Github version. install load development version package use: install stable version CRAN use: Downloading ESS data requires validating email every time download data. can set email environment variable set_email. ’s executed can delete previous line import_* call look email automatically, stored environment variable. Let’s suppose don’t know countries rounds available ESS. show_* family functions friend. find countries participated can use show_countries() function actually looks countries ESS website. new countries enter, automatically grab countries well. Let’s check Turkey. many rounds Turkey participated ? can use show_country_rounds() Note country names case sensitive. Use exact name printed show_countries() Using information, can download specific rounds easily import_country. Since essurvey 1.0.0 ess_* functions deprecated favor import_* download_* functions. turkey now list length(rounds) containing data frame round. specified one round, import_* functions return data frame. import_country useful want download specific rounds, . download rounds country automatically can use import_all_cntrounds. import_* family concerned downloading data thus always returns list containing data frames unless one round specified, returns tibble. Conversely, show_* family grabs information ESS website always returns vectors.
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("ropensci/essurvey") install.packages("essurvey") set_email("your@email.com") show_countries() ##  [1] "Albania"            "Austria"            "Belgium"            ##  [4] "Bulgaria"           "Croatia"            "Cyprus"             ##  [7] "Czechia"            "Denmark"            "Estonia"            ## [10] "Finland"            "France"             "Germany"            ## [13] "Greece"             "Hungary"            "Iceland"            ## [16] "Ireland"            "Israel"             "Italy"              ## [19] "Kosovo"             "Latvia"             "Lithuania"          ## [22] "Luxembourg"         "Montenegro"         "Netherlands"        ## [25] "Norway"             "Poland"             "Portugal"           ## [28] "Romania"            "Russian Federation" "Serbia"             ## [31] "Slovakia"           "Slovenia"           "Spain"              ## [34] "Sweden"             "Switzerland"        "Turkey"             ## [37] "Ukraine"            "United Kingdom" tk_rnds <- show_country_rounds("Turkey") tk_rnds ## [1] 2 4 turkey <-   import_country(     country = "Turkey",     rounds = c(2, 4)     ) import_all_cntrounds("Turkey")

title: Introduction to the essurvey package
text: Similarly, can use functions download rounds. see rounds currently available, use show_rounds. Similar show_countries, show_rounds interactively looks rounds ESS website, future rounds automatically included. download available rounds, use import_all_rounds Alternatively, use import_rounds selected ones.

Alternatively can use 'spss' 'sas'. save data ./myfolder/ESS_Turkey inside folder ESS2 folder contains data.

title: Introduction to the essurvey package
text: Whenever download ESS data, comes together script recodes values 6 = ‘applicable’, 7 = ‘Refusal’, 8 = ‘Don’t know’, 9 = ‘answer’ 9 = ‘available’ missings. However, case variables scaling 1-5. variables scaling 1-10 corresponding missings 66, 77, . first glance new users might know start calculating statistics variables … ..vector contains numbers 66, 77, shouldn’t . recode_missings() removes corresponding missings numeric variables well character variables. accepts complete tibble recodes variables recoded. also gives option recoding specific categories. example… …still missing values recoded ones specified. strongly suggest user recode categories missing without looking data might substantial differences people didn’t answer questions. user decided , use recode_missings recode everything corresponding recode_*_missings functions numeric character recodings separately. See documentation ?recode_missings information.
code: sp <- import_country("Spain", 1) mean(sp$tvtot) # 4.622406 new_coding <- recode_missings(sp) mean(new_coding$tvtot, na.rm = TRUE) # 4.527504 other_newcoding <- recode_missings(sp, c("Don't know", "Refusal")) table(other_newcoding$tvpol) #  0   1   2   3   4   5   6   7  66  # 167 460 610 252  95  36  26  31  45

title: Download Data from the European Social Survey on the Fly
text: European Social Survey (ESS) academically driven cross-national survey conducted across Europe since establishment 2001. Every two years, face--face interviews conducted newly selected, cross-sectional samples. survey measures attitudes, beliefs behavior patterns diverse populations thirty nations. Taken ESS website. Note: essurvey package originally called ess. Since essurvey 1.0.0 ess_* functions deprecated favor import_* download_* functions. Also, versions less including essurvey 1.0.1 returned wrong countries. Please install latest CRAN/Github version. essurvey package designed download ESS data easily possible. helper functions download rounds (term synonym waves denote survey different time points), rounds selected country show rounds/countries available. Check vignette documentation package’s website detailed examples essurvey package.

title: Download Data from the European Social Survey on the Fly
text: can install load development version commands: stable version :
code: # install.packages("devtools") in case you don't have it devtools::install_github("ropensci/essurvey") install.packages("essurvey")

title: Download Data from the European Social Survey on the Fly
text: First, need register ESS website, case haven’t. Please visit register section ESS website. email registered website, error raised prompting go register. Set valid email en environment variable. explore rounds/countries present ESS use show_*() family functions. download first round use R: return data frame containing first round. Typically, European Social Survey data files comes script recodes missing values NA different programs (Stata, SPSS, SAS). Use recode_missings recode values automatically. See package vignette greater detail see help page ?recode_missings. can also download several rounds supplying number rounds. download latest versions rounds 1 5 return list length 5 round data frame inside list. can check available rounds show_rounds() supply non existent round, function return error. Alternatively, can download available rounds import_all_rounds(). can also download rounds country: Use show_countries() see available countries show_country_rounds("Denmark") see available rounds chosen country. Alternatively, use import_all_cntrounds() download available rounds country. aware data ESS survey analyzed taking consideration sampling weights survey. useful example comes work Anthony Damico Daniel Oberski .
code: set_email("your@email.com") library(essurvey) show_countries() #>  [1] "Albania"            "Austria"            "Belgium"            #>  [4] "Bulgaria"           "Croatia"            "Cyprus"             #>  [7] "Czechia"            "Denmark"            "Estonia"            #> [10] "Finland"            "France"             "Germany"            #> [13] "Greece"             "Hungary"            "Iceland"            #> [16] "Ireland"            "Israel"             "Italy"              #> [19] "Kosovo"             "Latvia"             "Lithuania"          #> [22] "Luxembourg"         "Montenegro"         "Netherlands"        #> [25] "Norway"             "Poland"             "Portugal"           #> [28] "Romania"            "Russian Federation" "Serbia"             #> [31] "Slovakia"           "Slovenia"           "Spain"              #> [34] "Sweden"             "Switzerland"        "Turkey"             #> [37] "Ukraine"            "United Kingdom" one_round <- import_rounds(1) library(tidyverse)  one_round <-   import_rounds(1) %>%   recode_missings() five_rounds <- import_rounds(1:5) two_rounds <- import_rounds(c(1, 22)) #> Error in round_url(rounds) :  #> ESS round 22 is not a available. Check show_rounds() dk_two <- import_country("Denmark", 1:2)

Instead import_* functions, use download_* functions. save ESS rounds separate folders unzip specified directory (want know current directory, type getwd()). works way download_country(). aware download files manually read R haven package essurvey related functions work. Download integrated rounds separately for countries from the European Social
Survey — import_country

See show_rounds available rounds. ess_email character vector email, "your_email@email.com". registered ESS website, create account  http://www.europeansocialsurvey.org/user/new. preferred method login set_email. format format download data. default NULL import_* functions tries read 'stata', 'spss' 'sas' specific order. can useful countries particular format available.  Alternatively, user can specify format can either 'stata', 'spss' 'sas'. download_* functions set 'stata' format specified downloading. using import_country data downloaded read format specified. download_country, data downloaded specified format ('spss' 'stata' supported, see details). output_dir character vector output directory case want download files using download_country. Defaults working directory. interpreted directory path file name.

title:
Download integrated rounds separately for countries from the European Social
Survey — import_country
text: import_country length(rounds) 1, returns tibble latest version round. Otherwise returns list length(rounds) containing latest version round. download_country,  output_dir valid directory, returns saved directories invisibly saves rounds chosen format output_dir

title:
Download integrated rounds separately for countries from the European Social
Survey — import_country
text: Use import_country download specified rounds given country import R. import_all_cntrounds download rounds given country default download_country download rounds save specified format supplied directory. format argument import_country matter user data read R either way. However, different formats might different handling encoding questions. option preserved user can switch formats encoding errors found data. details see discussion . particular argument, 'sas' supported data formats changed ESS waves separate formats require different functions read. preserve parsimony format errors waves, user use 'spss' 'stata'.

title:
Download integrated rounds separately for countries from the European Social
Survey — import_country
code: if (FALSE) {  set_email("your_email@email.com")  # Get first three rounds for Denmark dk_three <- import_country("Denmark", 1:3)  # Only download the files, this will return nothing  temp_dir <- tempdir()  download_country(  "Turkey",  rounds = c(2, 4),  output_dir = temp_dir )  # By default, download_country downloads 'stata' files but # you can also download 'spss' or 'sas' files.  download_country(  "Turkey",  rounds = c(2, 4),  output_dir = temp_dir,  format = 'spss' )  # If email is not registered at ESS website, error will arise uk_one <- import_country("United Kingdom", 5, "wrong_email@email.com") # Error in authenticate(ess_email) :  # The email address you provided is not associated with any registered user. # Create an account at http://www.europeansocialsurvey.org/user/new  # If selected rounds don't exist, error will arise  czech_two <- import_country("Czech Republic", c(1, 22))  # Error in country_url(country, rounds) :  # Only rounds ESS1, ESS2, ESS4, ESS5, ESS6, ESS7, ESS8 available # for Czech Republic }

title: Download integrated rounds from the European Social Survey — import_rounds
code: if (FALSE) {  set_email("your_email@email.com")  # Get first three rounds three_rounds <- import_rounds(1:3)  temp_dir <- tempdir()  # Only download the files to output_dir, this will return nothing. download_rounds(  rounds = 1:3,  output_dir = temp_dir, )  # By default, download_rounds saves a 'stata' file. You can # also download 'spss' and 'sas' files.  download_rounds(  rounds = 1:3,  output_dir = temp_dir,  format = 'spss' )  # If rounds are repeated, will download only unique ones two_rounds <- import_rounds(c(1, 1))  # If email is not registered at ESS website, error will arise two_rounds <- import_rounds(c(1, 2), "wrong_email@email.com")  # Error in authenticate(ess_email) : # The email address you provided is not associated with any registered user. # Create an account at https://www.europeansocialsurvey.org/user/new  # If selected rounds don't exist, error will arise  two_rounds <- import_rounds(c(1, 22)) # Error in round_url(rounds) : # ESS round 22 is not a available. Check show_rounds() }

title: Download SDDF data by round for countries from the European Social Survey — import_sddf_country
text: SDDF data (Sample Design Data Files) data sets contain additional columns sample design weights given country given round. additional columns required perform complex weighted analysis ESS data. Users interested using data read description SDDF files read sampling design country analysis specific round. Use import_sddf_country download SDDF data country R. import_all_sddf_cntrounds download available SDDF data given country default download_sddf_country download SDDF data save specified format supplied directory. format argument import_country matter user data read R either way. However, different formats might different handling encoding questions. option preserved user can switch formats encoding errors found data. details see discussion . Additionally, given SDDF data complete, countries SDDF data Stata SPSS formats. reason, format argument used import_sddf_country. Internally, Stata chosen SPSS SPSS SAS order preference. particular argument, 'sas' supported data formats changed ESS waves separate formats require different functions read. preserve parsimony format errors waves, user use 'stata' 'spss'. Starting round 7 (including), ESS switched layout SDDF data. rounds, SDDF data published separately wave-country combination. round 7 onwards, SDDF data released single integrated file countries combined given round. import_sddf_country takes care nuance reading data filtering chosen country automatically. download_sddf_country downloads raw file also reads data memory subset specific country requested. process transparent user beware reading/writing data might delete properties dropping labels label attribute.

title: Download SDDF data by round for countries from the European Social Survey — import_sddf_country
code: if (FALSE) {  set_email("your_email@email.com")  sp_three <- import_sddf_country("Spain", 5:6)  show_sddf_cntrounds("Spain")  # Only download the files, this will return nothing  temp_dir <- tempdir()  download_sddf_country(  "Spain",  rounds = 5:6,  output_dir = temp_dir )  # By default, download_sddf_country downloads 'stata' files but # you can also download 'spss' or 'sas' files.  download_sddf_country(  "Spain",  rounds = 1:8,  output_dir = temp_dir,  format = 'spss' )  }

title: Recode pre-defined missing values as NA — recode_missings
text: ess_data data frame tibble data European Social Survey. data frame come either import_rounds, import_country read read_dta read_spss. case identifies missing values using labelled classes. missing_codes character vector values 'applicable', 'Refusal', 'Know', 'answer' 'available'. default values chosen. Note wording case sensitive. x labelled numeric y character vector

title: Recode pre-defined missing values as NA — recode_missings
text: Data European Social Survey always accompanied script recodes categories 'applicable', 'Refusal', 'Know', 'answer' 'available' missing. function recodes categories NA European Social Survey now provides values recoded automatically Stata data files. missing categories now read missing values read_dta, reading missing categories correctly Stata.example values coded, see . Old details: downloading data directly European Social Survey's website, downloaded .zip file contains script recodes categories missings Stata SPSS formats. recoding numeric variables recode_numeric_missings uses labels provided labelled class delete labels matched missing_codes. character variables matching done underlying number assigned category, namely 6, 7, 8, 9 9 'applicable', Refusal', 'Know', answer' 'available'. functions direct translation Stata script comes along downloading one rounds. Stata script rounds countries, meaning functions work rounds.

title: Recode pre-defined missing values as NA — recode_missings
code: if (FALSE) { seven <- import_rounds(7, your_email)  attr(seven$tvtot, "labels") mean(seven$tvtot, na.rm = TRUE)  names(table(seven$lnghom1)) # First three are actually missing values  seven_recoded <- recode_missings(seven)  attr(seven_recoded$tvtot, "labels") # All missings have been removed mean(seven_recoded$tvtot, na.rm = TRUE)  names(table(seven_recoded$lnghom1)) # All missings have been removed  # If you want to operate on specific variables # you can use other recode_*_missing   seven$tvtot <- recode_numeric_missing(seven$tvtot)  # Recode only 'Don't know' and 'No answer' to missing seven$tvpol <- recode_numeric_missing(seven$tvpol, c("Don't know", "No answer"))   # The same can be done with recode_strings_missing }

text: rounds numeric vector specifying rounds return countries. Use show_roundsfor list available rounds. participate logical controls whether show participating countries /rounds countries participate. Set TRUE default.

title: Return countries that participated in all of the specified rounds. — show_rounds_country
text: character vector country names

title: Return countries that participated in all of the specified rounds. — show_rounds_country
text: show_rounds_country returns countries participated specified rounds. , show_rounds_country(1:2) return countries participated round 1 round 2. Conversely, participate = FALSE return countries participate round 1 round 2.

title: Return countries that participated in all of the specified rounds. — show_rounds_country
code: if (FALSE) {  # Return countries that participated in round 2  show_rounds_country(2)  # Return countries that participated in all rounds  show_rounds_country(1:8)  # Return countries that didn't participate in the first three rounds  show_rounds_country(1:3, participate = FALSE)  }

essurvey 1.0.8
text: CRAN release: 2022-01-09 Fixes URL creation bug (#53)

title: essurvey 1.0.7
text: CRAN release: 2021-03-22 CRAN maintenance release. vignettes now precompiled avoid errors ESS website breaks reason. ess_email environmental variable renamed ESS_EMAIL comply Github Actions standards

title: essurvey 1.0.6
text: CRAN release: 2021-01-27 CRAN maintenance release fix Solaris warnings Warning engine$weave(file, quiet = quiet, encoding = enc) : Pandoc (>= 1.12.3) /pandoc-citeproc available. Falling back R Markdown v1 CRAN. Tested Rhub passes OK, notifying CRAN. Removes automatic citation message loading package. ’s actually annoying.

title: essurvey 1.0.5
text: CRAN release: 2019-12-11 CRAN maintenance release add informative message status code HTTP request ‘www.europeansocialsurvey.org’ 300.

title: essurvey 1.0.5
text: tests/examples now excluded running CRAN based warning Brian Ripley: ‘Packages use Internet resources fail gracefully informative message resource available (give check warning error).’ forced run Travis Appveyor made clear cran-comments.md

title: essurvey 1.0.4
text: CRAN release: 2019-11-04 CRAN maintenance check release ESS round 9.

title: essurvey 1.0.3
text: CRAN release: 2019-10-15

title: essurvey 1.0.3
text: don’t know format available round/country, import_* download_* functions now accept NULL argument runs 'stata', 'spss' 'sas' formats automatically. default, import_* functions now format set NULL automatically try three different formats. breaks backward dependency slightly ‘stata’ set default.

title: essurvey 1.0.3
text: Users can now download SDDF (weight data) country/round combination files. Functions show_sddf_cntrounds, import_sddf_country download_sddf_country now introduced. technical purposes, show_sddf_cntrounds needs user set registered ESS email set_email. [#9]

title: essurvey 1.0.3
text: Bumps haven minimum package version 2.1.1 New package website https://docs.ropensci.org/essurvey

title: essurvey 1.0.3
text: read_format_data now tries read data using haven falls backs foreign case ’s error. work SDDF data [#38]. read_format_data read_sddf_data now always return list. Checking length data return data frame now happens within import_* function.

title: essurvey 1.0.3
text: Removes unnecessary statement set_email didn’t allow overwrite email set.

title: essurvey 1.0.2
text: CRAN release: 2018-08-23

title: essurvey 1.0.2
text: show_country_rounds checks missing values excludes .

title: essurvey 1.0.2
text: import_all_cntrounds import_country returned incorrect countries [#31]

title: essurvey 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-06-02

title: essurvey 1.0.1
text: ess_email now checked "" wasn’t raising error . Removes round argument import_all_cntrounds mistake. already grabs rounds internally.

title: essurvey 1.0.1
text: CRAN release: 2018-06-02 Minor release Fixes test checks number rounds country . test mistake rounds change time passes precise country rounds shouldn’t tested.

title: essurvey 1.0.0
text: CRAN release: 2018-04-06 ess package renamed essurvey name conflict Emacs Speaks Statistics (ESS). See R-pkg mailing list, post related release ess-0-0-1.

title: essurvey 1.0.0
text: ess_rounds ess_all_rounds deprecated removed next release. Use import_rounds instead [#22] ess_country ess_all_cntrounds deprecated removed next release. Use import_countries instead [#22] your_email argument name ess_* functions changed ess_email [#23]

title: essurvey 1.0.0
text: import_rounds, import_all_rounds download_rounds introduced replacements ess_rounds ess_all_rounds. changes repeated ess_country ess_all_cntrounds [#22] set_email set email environmental variable rather write call [#23] requests ESS website now done HTTPS rather HTTP [#24] Add package level documentation [#20]

title: essurvey 1.0.0
text: ess_email default value now NULL default [#23] format argument now checked match.arg rather manual check [#25]
